New York Explore The City

Little Italy

Little Italy

The first thing you’ll see upon arrival in Little Italy is a horde of white-aproned waiters barreling at you from the doorways of their respective restaurants. Each waiter will wave a menu at you and proclaim that this establishment is the oldest, the most authentic, the most delicious, the most Italian! And each of these menus is more or less identical.

K-Town

K-Town

Hidden on West 32nd street, is a food paradise known as Koreatown; it is packed full of Korean restaurants, bars, bookshops, and beauty boutiques. From authentic Korean barbecue spots to restaurants that specialize in hot pots, homemade tofu, and handmade dumplings, to a dessert bar that focuses on beautifully plated green tea-infused desserts, you’re guaranteed not to leave K-town hungry.

Soho

Soho

The famously arty neighborhood of the ’70s and ’80s has evolved into one of New York City’s prime shopping districts. Once you’ve had your dose of retail therapy, take a break with a meal at one of the neighborhood’s many excellent restaurants or a drink at one of its elegant boutique hotels.

Visit Each Place

  • 42 Street

    42 street, also known as Times Square, is the wrost place to be. Do not, under any circumstances, go here unless you want to be trampled by tourists and mascots and crackheads.- em

  • Oculus

    I do not know about the Oculus. However, there is a nice gaming console that has a similar name. The Oculus Rift is a virtual reality headset. Using that would be much better than going outside.-kelly

  • Central Park

    Central Park is a park located in the enter of Manhattan. There's grass and tress and uh more grass and tress. Totally instagram worthy. Throw on your uggs, get a pumkin spice latte, find a spot anwhere here and you have a perfect picture. Then you may proceed to leave because there's nothing more to do.-emily

  • Empire State Building

    So many lines dude. You get in line to buy a ticket and then wait in line for a metal detector and then wait in line for a phone and then wait in line for an elevator. Not worth it fam. -yelp

  • Flat Iron Building

    The flat iron building- not actually made of flat irons, very disappointed with this experience!! -angle

  • Rockefeller

    A place where my brother got run over by 3 teenager girls on skates. He is now afraid of skating. And girls.

  • Statue of Liberty

    You can’t actually visit it but you can take the Staten Island Ferry to see it. But that means you have to go to Staten Island and that is the worst possible thing you can do in NYC. -em

The Orchid Show is a display of floral arrangements and artistic installations at Enid A. Haupt Conservatory plus evening entertainment.

If you crave an escape from the city that won’t land you in debt, head to the ever-changing urban oasis of Governors Island, NY which combines park, concert venue, adult playground and outdoor art space into a single lovely haven for adventure.
